nib.text:
A 12-year-old child was critically injured in a shooting in the SumnerâGlenwood neighborhood Wednesday afternoon, police say.

At approximately 3:40 p.m., the Minneapolis Police Department received a report of a shooting near N 8th Ave and N Aldrich Ave. EMS personnel were also dispatched to the scene.

Upon arrival, MPD officers reported a 10-year-old boy had been shot.

According to [a report from KARE,](https://www.kare11.com/article/news/crime/witnesses-say-child-shot-in-north-minneapolis/89-4f5294f1-4d26-41e7-8911-220b9a6609f8) police later confirmed a 12-year-old boy was shot and advised he is in critical condition.

As of 5:45 p.m., [multiple news outlets report](https://www.fox9.com/news/boy-12-dies-in-shooting-after-dispute-in-north-minneapolis-neighborhood) the boy has been pronounced deceased.

In a statement to KARE, police characterized the shooting as âa neighborhood dispute that ended in gunfire.â

[An additional report from WCCO](https://minnesota.cbslocal.com/2021/09/08/12-year-old-shot-minneapolis/) stated police are searching for a juvenile suspect who fled the scene in a vehicle. Officers have not provided further suspect information.
